dataset.description:
Weld County currently holds a federally-mandated Municipal Separate Storm Sewer System (MS4) Permit issued by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment (CDPHE) for all unincorporated urban areas within the County. As required by the permit, a Stormwater Management Program was developed with a goal of reducing the amount stormwater pollution entering local creeks, streams and rivers from these urbanized areas. Urbanized areas are determined by US Census data, which is updated every 10 years.

Link to Weld County Public Works Stormwater Quality

dataset.description:
TaxAreaAuths – This table contains Tax Areas and the Authorities that make up the Tax Area.  You can either find which authorities levy taxes within a given Tax District (by filtering on TaxDistrict) or you can find which Tax Districts a given authority falls within (by filtering on TaxingAuthority).

Following are definitions for each of the field names:

TAXYEAR – Current tax year.

TAXDISTRICT – 4-digit code representing a tax district/area.  Can be linked to the AREAID field in the LevyTotals data table or AREAID in the Ownership data table.

TAXINGAUTHORITY – 4-digit code for the Taxing Authorities within each tax district.  This field links to the GROUPID field in the AuthGroup data table to find a name for each authority.

dataset.description: The intent of the Site Plan Review procedure is to provide present and future residents and users of land in the COUNTY a means whereby orderly and harmonious DEVELOPMENT is ensured in the COUNTY. Site Plan Reviews require additional consideration to ensure that the USES permitted are established and operated in a manner that is compatible with existing and planned land USES in the NEIGHBORHOOD. The regulation of Site Plan Reviews is designed to protect and promote the health, safety, convenience and general welfare of the present and future residents of the COUNTY. Developed from the approved land use application and permitting process.

dataset.description:
Sec. 21-5-210. Boundaries of area covered by designation; division of the Weld Mineral Resource (Oil and Gas) Area into two Planning Areas.

The entire unincorporated area of Weld County has been designated as a mineral resource (oil and gas) area and the exploration and production of oil and gas within the area shall be subject to this designation and these 1041 WOGLA Regulations.  The Weld County Mineral Resource (Oil and Gas) Area is divided into the two (2) planning regions shown on the map in Appendix 21-B, denominated as the “Ag-Rural Planning Area” and the “Near-Urban Planning Area.”  The regulations set forth in this Article V may be dependent upon the planning region in which the Oil and Gas Location is situated. This dataset was created in conjunction with the Oil and Gas Department to be updated on a yearly basis when reviewed in County Code.

dataset.description:
Tax_Auth – This table provides a breakdown of the types of mill levies that each taxing authority levies.

Following are definitions for each of the field names:

AUTHID – Type of Levy

TAXYEAR –Tax year for which taxes were levied.

MILLLEVY – Mill levy for individual Authority and Type of Levy.

GROUPID – Identification # for each taxing authority. This field correlates with the TaxingAuthority field in the TaxAreaAuth table.  Link to the GROUPID field in AuthGroup data table to find a name for each authority.

NAME – Name of Levy.

dataset.description:
SecondaryNameOwnershipList – This table contains the secondary owners for each parcel.  For primary ownership, look at the Ownership data table.  There is one row for every additional owner on any account with more than just a primary owner.

Following are definitions for each of the field names:

ACCOUNTNO – Account Number

SECONDARYNAME – Secondary/Additional Owner Name

dataset.description:
Sales – This table contains all recorded documents that the Assessor’s Office has associated with one or more Weld County parcels.  Generally, any document affecting ownership or legal description of parcels will be in this data table.  If you need a complete listing of all recorded documents, please refer to the Clerk and Recorder’s system.  There is one line per RECEPTNO and ACCOUNTNO combination.  For example, if a document refers to more than one parcel, there will be a line for each ACCOUNTNO and the RECEPTNO will be the same on each line.

Following are definitions for each of the field names:

ACCOUNTNO – Account Number

RECEPTNO – Reception Number.  Can be used to lookup documents in the Clerk and Recorder system.

GRANTOR – Grantor Name (Seller)

GRANTEE – Grantee Name (Buyer)

SALEP – Sale Price

SALEDT – Sale Date (Note: A sale date of 1/1/1900 more likely means an unknown sale date for older documents.  Actual sale dates can be found by reviewing the document in the Clerk’s system.)

DEEDTYPE – Deed Type Code

DOCFEE – Doc Fee (Recording Fee)

DOCDT – Doc Date (Date Recorded)

IMPVAC – Improved/Vacant

dataset.title: Sales

dataset.description:
Ownership – This table contains the ownership, address, legal description, tax area and value for each parcel.  There is one row of data per account.  Only the primary owner is listed.  For additional owners on the account, reference the SecondaryNameOwnershipList data table.

Following are definitions for each of the field names:

ACCOUNTNO – Account Number

NAMEADDRID – For internal use

NAMETYPE – P=Primary Owner.  For additional owners, see SecondaryNameOwnershipList data table.

NAME – Owner Name

CAREOF – In Care of

ADDRESS1 – Mailing Address1

ADDRESS2 – Mailing Address2

CITY – City of Mailing Address

STATE – State of Mailing Address

ZIP – Zip Code of Mailing Address

PARCELNB – Parcel Number

MHSPACE – Mobile Home space

PARCELSEQ – This field no longer used

AREAID – Tax Area Identification #.   See TaxAreaAuths data table for a list of taxing authorities in the area.  See LevyTotals data table for the mill levy associated with this tax area.

ACCTTYPE – Type of Account (Commercial, Residential, Vacant Land, etc.).  For multi-use properties (i.e. Commercial and Residential), ACCTTYPE will reflect the primary use of the property.

BUSINESSNAME – Business Name

MAPNO – Map # (for internal use)

BORDERINGCOUNTY – This field is no longer used

BACODE – For Personal Property Accounts, identifies the type of business.  Contact our office for a description of what each code means.

LAGENT – This field is no longer used

STREETNO – Street # of physical location

STREETNAME – Street Name of physical location

LANDACT – Land Actual Value

IMPACT -  Improvement Actual Value

LANDASD – Land Assessed Value

IMPASD – Improvement Assessed Value

ACRES – Land lot size in Acres

SQFT – Total Square Feet of all Improvements

UNITS – Land lot size in SF

LEGAL – Legal Description of property

APRDIST – This field is no longer used

BA_OWNER_ID – This field is no longer used

BA_LOCATION – This field is no longer used

STREETALP – Unit or Apartment Number of Physical Address

STREETDIR – Street Direction of Physical Address (North, East, South, West)

STREETSUF – Street suffix of Physical Address (Ave, Street, Court, Blvd)

LOCCITY –City of physical location.  Unincorporated areas will be WELD or blank.

LANDSQFT – Land lot size in square feet

SUBCODE – Subdivision code

SUBNAME – Subdivision name

CONDOCODE – This field no longer used

CONDONAME – This field no longer used

SALEP – Sale Price of most recent sale

SALEDT – Sale Date of most recent sale

DOCFEE – Doc Fee (Fee to record the deed) of most recent sale

DEEDTYPE – Deed Type Code of most recent sale

BLOCK – Block#

LOT – Lot #

CONDOUNIT – This field no longer used

BOOK – Book # of most recent sale.  No longer used by Clerk and Recorder’s Office.  Only populated on older sales.  Use RECEPTION_NO instead.

PAGE – Page # of most recent sale.  No longer used by Clerk and Recorder’s Office.  Only populated on older sales.  Use RECEPTION_NO instead.

RECEPTION_NO – Reception # of most recent sale

 

For a complete Property Address, combine the following field names in this order:

PROPERTY ADDRESS: STREETNO, STREETDIR, STREETNAME, STREETSUF, STREETALP

dataset.title: Ownership

dataset.description:
ImpsCurrentInvntry – This table contains property characteristics for each building on each parcel.  There is one line in the table for each building or section of building (in multi-use buildings) on the parcel/account.  If you are wanting one line per account, you will want to use the AcctCurrentInvntry data table.

Following are definitions for each of the field names:

ACCOUNTNO – Account Number

BLDGID – This is an arbitrary building #. If there is more than one building on an account, each building will have a different #. 

PROPTYPE – This field describes the type of Property.

SF – Total Square Feet of structure.

BLTASSF – Total Square Feet of building section.  Will match the SF field unless the building has more than one section (i.e. part office, part residential).

MULTIBLTASFLAG – Indicates whether there are multiple Built As descriptions.

 

CONDOSF – Square footage of Condos.

 

UNITTYPE – Indicates location of Condo, Townhouse, Triplex, etc.  (i.e. inside vs. end unit)

 

OCCUPANCY – Indicates how the property is being used. 

 

OCCPERC – Percent of building being used for the listed occupancy as of January 1st.

 

BLTASDESC – Description of structure or architectural style.

 

HEATTYPE – Type of heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC).

 

EXTERIOR – Type of siding.

 

INTERIOR – Type of interior walls.

 

STORIES - # of stories.

 

STORYHT – Average height of each floor in the structure.

 

SPRINKLER – Square footage of the building covered by indoor fire sprinklers.

 

ROOFTYPE – Type of roof.

 

ROOFCOVER – Type of roof covering (i.e. Composition Shingle, Clay Tile, Metal Ribbing)

 

FLOORCOVER – Type of floor covering

 

FOUNDATION – Type of foundation

 

ROOMS - # of rooms.

 

BEDROOMS - # of bedrooms.

 

BATHS - # of bathrooms.

 

UNITS - # of units.

 

OTHER – No longer used.

 

CLASS – Class of structure (A=Fireproof Steel; B=Reinforced Concrete; C=Masonry; D=Wood Frame; S=Metal Frame; P=Pole; H=Hoop Arch; N=None)

 

YRBLT – Year Built

 

YRREMODELED – Year Remodeled

 

AGE – Effective Age of structure

 

BLTASLENGTH – Building Length

 

BLTASWIDTH – Building Width

 

MHMAKE – Make of Manufactured Home

 

MHTAGLENGTH – Manufactured Home tag length

 

MHTAGWIDTH – Manufactured Home tag width

 

MHSKIRT – What the Manufactured Home Skirt is made of

 

MHSKIRTLF – Linear Feet of Manufactured Home Skirt

dataset.title: ImpsCurrentInvntry

dataset.description:
AcctCurrentInvntry – This table contains a summary of property characteristics for each parcel.  It returns one line per account, regardless of the number of buildings on the parcel. If you are wanting individual lines per building, you will want to use the ImpsCurrentInvntry data table.

Following are definitions for each of the field names:

ACCOUNTNO – Account Number

PARCELNB – Parcel Number

ACCTTYPE – Account Type (i.e. Vacant Land, Residential) – Represents predominant use of the property.

BLDGS – Number of buildings on the parcel

LEA – Land Economic Area – This field correlates with the LEA data table to give you a description of the LEA.

SUBNO – Subdivision #

PROPTYPE – Property Type – This represents the property type of the primary improvement (structure) on the property.

OCCCODE1 – Occupancy Code – This is the first Occupancy Code of the building.

OCCCODE2 – Occupancy Code – This is the second Occupancy Code of the building if there is more than one Occupancy Code.

OCCCODE3 - Occupancy Code – This is the third Occupancy Code of the building if there is more than two Occupancy Codes.

IMPABSTCODE – Improvement Abstract Code. Classification code used for state level reporting.  This field correlates with the AbstCode data table to give you the description of the Abstract Code.

BLTASID – Built As ID (building or architectural style).

YRBLT – Year Built.  This represents the year the primary structure was built.

EXTERIOR – This field describes what type of exterior the structure is made of (i.e. Frame hardboard, Masonry) for primary building.

CLASS – Indicates type of construction for primary building.

HVAC – Type of heating and air conditioning for primary building.

ROOMS – Number of rooms

BEDROOMS – Number of bedrooms

BATHS – Number of baths

TOTALFIXTURES – Total number of fixtures

TOTALIMPSSF – Total Improvement Square Feet

RESIDENTIALSF – Residential Square Feet

COMMERCIALSF – Commercial Square Feet

OUTBUILDINGSF – Outbuilding Square Feet

PORCHSF – Porch Square Feet

CARPORTSF – Carport Square Feet

MEZZANINESF – Mezzanine Square Feet

BALCONYSF – Balcony Square Feet

BSMNTUNFINSF – Unfinished Basement Square Feet

BSMNTFAIRFINSF – Fair Finished Basement Square Feet

BSMNTMINFINSF – No longer used

BSMNTFULLFINSF – Full Finished Basement Square Feet

BSMNTTOTALFINSF – Total Finished Basement Square Feet

WALKOUT – Walkout Basement – 0=No; 1=Yes

GARATTACHSF – Attached Garage Square Feet

GARDETACHSF – Detached Garage Square Feet

GARBUILTINSF – Built In Garage Square Feet

GARBASEMENTSF – Basement Garage Square Feet

GARTOTALSF – Total Garage Square Feet

MULTIUSEFLAG – Multi Use Flag – 0=No; 1=Yes.  Indicates whether a property is classified as multi-purpose (i.e. Residential and Commercial)

LANDTYPE – Type of Land (i.e. Ag Land, Vacant Land, Residential Land)

LANDABSTCODE – Land Abstract Code – Classification code used for state level reporting.  This field correlates with the AbstCode data table to give you the description of the Abstract Code.

LANDCERTCODE – This field is no longer used.

GROSSACRES – Land lot size in Acres

GROSSSF – Land lot size in Square Feet

GROSSFF – Front Feet of lot

GROSSUNITS –Units related to land, when applicable (i.e. Manufacture Home Spaces or pad sites)

STREETNO – Street Number of Physical Address

STREETALP – Unit or Apartment Number of Physical Address

STREETDIR – Street Direction of Physical Address

STREETSUF – Street Suffix of Physical Address

STREETNAME – Street Name of Physical Address

LOCZIP – No longer used.

LOCCITY – City of physical location.  Unincorporated areas will be WELD or blank.

TAXYEAR – Tax Year for physical characteristics.  Property characteristics in this table reflect the status of the property (i.e. New Construction) as of January 1 of the tax year.

 

For a complete Property Address, combine the following field names in this order:

PROPERTY ADDRESS: STREETNO, STREETDIR, STREETNAME, STREETSUF, STREETALP

dataset.description: LevyTotals – This table contains the Tax Area and the total mill levy for that Tax Area.  AREAID is a 4 digit code representing the taxing authorities in a given geographic area.  To see what authorities are in an area, use the AREAID field in this table to lookup the authorities in the Tax_Area_Auth data table.  To identify which tax area an account is located in, look at the Ownership data table.

dataset.description: AuthGroup – This table contains the Group ID in numeric format and the Group ID descriptions that correspond to a Taxing Authority name.  This table can be used in conjunction with the Tax_Auth table to identify mill levies for each taxing authority.  This table can also be used in conjunction with the Tax_Area_Auths data table to identify which Taxing Authorities are present with a given Tax Area.

dataset.description: AbstCode - This table contains the 4-digit abstract code in numeric format along with the abstract code description.  Abstract codes represent the classification used for state level reporting and is based on the use of the property.  To find accounts with a given AbstCode, refer to the AcctCurrentInvntry data table and filter on the IMPABSTCODE and LANDABSTCODE fields.
